metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000111 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
Linux kernel: heap out-of-bounds in AF_PACKET sockets. This new issue isanalogous to previously disclosed CVE-2016-8655. In both cases, a socketoption that changes socket state may race with safety checks inpacket_set_ring. Previously with PACKET_VERSION. This time withPACKET_RESERVE. The solution is similar: lock the socket for the update.This issue may be exploitable, we did not investigate further. As thisissue affects PF_PACKET sockets, it requires CAP_NET_RAW in the processnamespace. But note that with user namespaces enabled, any process cancreate a namespace in which it has CAP_NET_RAW.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
